verses.translation: The sure calamity!
What is the sure calamity!
And what would make you realize what the sure calamity is!
Samood and Ad called the striking calamity a lie.
Then as to Samood, they were destroyed by an excessively severe punishment.

verses.text_madani: وَأَمَّا عَادٌ فَأُهْلِكُوا بِرِيحٍ صَرْصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٍ
verses.translation: And as to Ad, they were destroyed by a roaring, violent blast.

verses.text_madani: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيْهِمْ سَبْعَ لَيَالٍ وَثَمَانِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومًا فَتَرَى الْقَوْمَ فِيهَا صَرْعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ خَاوِيَةٍ
verses.translation: Which He made to prevail against them for seven nights and eight days unremittingly, so that you might have seen the people therein prostrate as if they were the trunks of hollow palms.
Do you then see of them one remaining?

verses.text_madani: وَجَاءَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَن قَبْلَهُ وَالْمُؤْتَفِكَاتُ بِالْخَاطِئَةِ
verses.translation: And Firon and those before him and the overthrown cities continuously committed sins.

verses.text_madani: فَعَصَوْا رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَهُمْ أَخْذَةً رَّابِيَةً
verses.translation: And they disobeyed the Messenger of their Lord, so He punished them with a vehement punishment.

verses.text_madani: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَى الْمَاءُ حَمَلْنَاكُمْ فِي الْجَارِيَةِ
verses.translation: Surely We bore you up in the ship when the water rose high,

verses.text_madani: لِنَجْعَلَهَا لَكُمْ تَذْكِرَةً وَتَعِيَهَا أُذُنٌ وَاعِيَةٌ
verses.translation: So that We may make it a reminder to you, and that the retaining ear might retain it.

words.translation: and would be conscious of it

verses.text_madani: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِي الصُّورِ نَفْخَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ
verses.translation: And when the trumpet is blown with a single blast,

verses.text_madani: وَحُمِلَتِ الْأَرْضُ وَالْجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةً وَاحِدَةً
verses.translation: And the earth and the mountains are borne away and crushed with a single crushing.
On that day shall the great event come to pass,
And the heaven shall cleave asunder, so that on that day it shall be frail,

verses.text_madani: وَالْمَلَكُ عَلَىٰ أَرْجَائِهَا ۚ وَيَحْمِلُ عَرْشَ رَبِّكَ فَوْقَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ ثَمَانِيَةٌ
verses.translation: And the angels shall be on the sides thereof; and above them eight shall bear on that day your Lord's power.

verses.text_madani: يَوْمَئِذٍ تُعْرَضُونَ لَا تَخْفَىٰ مِنكُمْ خَافِيَةٌ
verses.translation: On that day you shall be exposed to view-- no secret of yours shall remain hidden.

verses.text_madani: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ بِيَمِينِهِ فَيَقُولُ هَاؤُمُ اقْرَءُوا كِتَابِيَهْ
verses.translation: Then as for him who is given his book in his right hand, he will say: Lo! read my book:
Surely I knew that I shall meet my account.
So he shall be in a life of pleasure,
In a lofty garden,
The fruits of which are near at hand:

verses.text_madani: كُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا هَنِيئًا بِمَا أَسْلَفْتُمْ فِي الْأَيَّامِ الْخَالِيَةِ
verses.translation: Eat and drink pleasantly for what you did beforehand in the days gone by.

verses.text_madani: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ بِشِمَالِهِ فَيَقُولُ يَا لَيْتَنِي لَمْ أُوتَ كِتَابِيَهْ
verses.translation: And as for him who is given his book in his left hand he shall say: O would that my book had never been given me:
And I had not known what my account was:
O would that it had made an end (of me):
My wealth has availed me nothing:
My authority is gone away from me.
Lay hold on him, then put a chain on him,
Then cast him into the burning fire,

verses.text_madani: ثُمَّ فِي سِلْسِلَةٍ ذَرْعُهَا سَبْعُونَ ذِرَاعًا فَاسْلُكُوهُ
verses.translation: Then thrust him into a chain the length of which is seventy cubits.

verses.text_madani: إِنَّهُ كَانَ لَا يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ الْعَظِيمِ
verses.translation: Surely he did not believe in Allah, the Great,
Nor did he urge the feeding of the poor.
Therefore he has not here today a true friend,
Nor any food except refuse,
Which none but the wrongdoers eat.
But nay! I swear by that which you see,
And that which you do not see.
Most surely, it is the Word brought by an honored Messenger,

verses.text_madani: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَاعِرٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَّا تُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.translation: And it is not the word of a poet; little is it that you believe;

verses.text_madani: وَلَا بِقَوْلِ كَاهِنٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.translation: Nor the word of a soothsayer; little is it that you mind.
It is a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
And if he had fabricated against Us some of the sayings,
We would certainly have seized him by the right hand,
Then We would certainly have cut off his aorta.

verses.text_madani: فَمَا مِنكُم مِّنْ أَحَدٍ عَنْهُ حَاجِزِينَ
verses.translation: And not one of you could have withheld Us from him.
And most surely it is a reminder for those who guard (against evil).
And most surely We know that some of you are rejecters.
And most surely it is a great grief to the unbelievers.
